page.title: 03HOUSING AT EASTFIELD
page.content: Most of the houses on the Eastfield estate are made of brick and are usually semi_detached or terraced with front and rear gardens. In between the houses are open grass areas with the occasional tree. The council built the estate originally and owned all the houses but now some tenants are deciding to buy their own house from the council. A typical house has two, three or four bedrooms, a living room, kitchen, toilet and bathroom. A large number of houses are heated by gas and the others use coal, coke or electricity. Houses do not have garages adjacent or attached to them but there are blocks of garages spaced around the estate. Most houses have telephones and televisions.
